title: Money multiplier and increase in loans

content.prompt: Southern City Bank has $100 million in deposits and has $8 million in excess reserves. If the required reserve ratio is 5%, which of the following is true?

choices.label: The money multiplier is 20, and the bank can lend out up to $160 million.
The money multiplier is 8, and the bank can lend out up to $20 million.
The money multiplier is 8, and the bank can lend out up to $5 million.
The money multiplier is 8, and loans can increase in the banking system by a maximum of $8 million.
The money multiplier is 20, and loans can increase in the banking system by a maximum of $160 million.

topic.text: 4.4: Banking and the Expansion of the Money Supply

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Interpret a specific economic outcome using quantitative data or calculations.
